SENT.plain: We report four patients with relapsed or refractory follicular (three) and lymphoplasmacytic (one) lymphoma who achieved complete remission (CR) with fludarabine (FDR) lasting from 3.2 to 6 years
One had stage III and three stage IV and were resistant to chlorambucil and/or anthracycline
FDR was well tolerated, the only complication being herpes zoster infection in three patients, which was controlled with aciclovir
One patient developed a gastric MALT lymphoma from a different clone than the follicular lymphoma
In conclusion, some patients with refractory low-grade lymphoma achieve long-term CR with FDR: therefore this agent may be considered as alternative to stem-cell transplantation
